qas.question: What work is Mansur ibn Muhammad ibn al-Faqih Ilyas known for writing?
In what century did Tashrih al-badan come into being?
Who wrote The Canon of Medicine?
Who first established the fields of anatomy and phusiology?

plausible_answers.text: Mansur ibn Muhammad ibn al-Faqih Ilyas

qas.question: Who wrote Anatomy of the body in the 1500's?

plausible_answers.text: the body's structural, nervous and circulatory systems

qas.question: What photos where found in Anatomy of the body?
What book was a standard text in universities until the 1800's?
What Latin encyclopedia was used in medical schools for centuries?

context: <b5_0>Muslim physicians<b5_0/> contributed to the field of medicine, including the subjects of anatomy and physiology: such as in the <a1_0>15th century<a1_0/> Persian work by <b6_0>Mansur ibn Muhammad ibn al-Faqih Ilyas<b6_0/> entitled <a0_0>Tashrih al-badan (Anatomy of the body)<a0_0/> which contained comprehensive diagrams of <b7_0>the body's structural, nervous and circulatory systems<b7_0/>; or in the work of the Egyptian physician <a2_0>Ibn al-Nafis<a2_0/>, who proposed the theory of pulmonary circulation. <a3_0>Avicenna<a3_0/>'s <b8_0>The Canon of Medicine<b8_0/> remained an authoritative medical textbook in Europe until the 18th century. <a4_0>Abu al-Qasim al-Zahrawi<a4_0/> (also known as Abulcasis) contributed to the discipline of medical surgery with his Kitab al-Tasrif ("<b9_0>Book of Concessions"<b9_0/>), a medical encyclopedia which was later translated to Latin and used in European and Muslim medical schools for centuries. Other medical advancements came in the fields of pharmacology and pharmacy.
